comment.narrative: This is a new stream of work with no baseline value. NIMD Jordan is committed to reflect on its experience and knowledge and lessons learned to reflect alignment and partnership with the PoD consortium members to strengthen capacities and foster learning to effectively promote inclusive democracy . NIMD Jordan is also committed to participate in international multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings as invited.
Four multi-stakeholders’ meetings were held: - POD orientation - Series of NIMD SoP experiences worldwide - PEA sessions - M&E training

In 2021 Four multi-stakeholders meetings between NIMD Jordan and PoD partners to demonstrate engagement on inclusive democratic space which aims to develop skills that are reused in NIMD Jordan programming and that aim to educate on democracy education and advocacy .

comment.narrative: NIMD Jordan staff and local CSOs are not yet working in the context of the PoD programme. NIMD Jordan is committed to strengthen its capacity and enhance its knowledge as well as coordinate activities around key knowledge areas (e.g. Gender, dialogue, democracy education, etc.) between consortium members and NIMD Jordan and as applicable local CSOs.

Two staff members were trained on: - PEA training - PEA session with Ethiopia - M&E training and Q&A Sessions - OH approach for monitoring - Workshops of “Talking about dialogue” - Capacity Scan Jordan - Training on EU funding and NDICI

title.narrative: # of women/youth leaders trained

description.narrative: # of women/youth leaders trained

comment.narrative: The PEA showed, the organizational structures of PMY are weak. The institutional framework for youth engagement involves many diverse institutions but lacks coherence and falls short of that aim. Certain forms of youth participation are underdeveloped, such as direct involvement in designing and elaborating activities and access to engagement information and tools. Youth with interest in political activism and potentially early starts in public political engagement will be taken on board by NIMD Jordan and they will have their skills developed.

118 aspiring women/youth leaders were trained: • 35 youth in the NIMD SoP by the end of the program the youth presented their graduation projects ( 6 projects ) among the attendees were parliament members who were interested to work with the youth to further support their projects. • 50 youth in the political component of youth in the Crown Prince Foundation leadership program • 18 women in the “Women in local administration” held in partnership with the IRI by the end of the program the women presented their work and recommendations to the chairperson of the women’s sub-committee from the Royal Committee to modernize Political System, H.E Samar Al Haj Hassan as well as the Women’s committee at the Parliament. • 15 youth trained part of the dialogue incubator in Karak governorate run in partnership with the PSI.

At the end of the year 2021, 100 PMY have their capacity increased through the SoP / Democracy school. NIMD Jordan will provide training, structure, opportunity, and tools, to become ready to engage in political activism and advocacy and thus share awareness through social media, advocate for legislation, engage in community service, or even prepare a policy paper.

title.narrative: # of L&A activities for making the political system more inclusive (in relation to women / youth / minority groups) at national level

description.narrative: # of L&A activities for making the political system more inclusive (in relation to women / youth / minority groups) at national level

comment.narrative: Based on the PEA, NIMD Jordan needs to diversify the work to include work with PMY in national and with CSOs. initiating dialogue platforms at local levels that leads to partnership and coalition building in terms of L&A initiatives

7 L&A initiatives for reforms were produced by SoP students and students from the pilot for dialogue incubators in Karak. • A letter with the recommendations by the SoP youth, based on the dialogue session that was held on Friday, July 30, 2021, with members of the Royal Committee to Modernize the Political System, presented to the head of the committee HE Samir Al-Rifai, Chairman of the Royal Committee to Modernize the Political System. • Two L&A initiatives were prepared and presented by the women participating in the program held in cooperation with IRI • Four projects Sop projects from the pilot project were submitted, the projects were : o Amendment to the obligatory will in CEDAW o Repeal Article 11 of the Cybercrime Law o Amending the system of petitions in the House of Representatives o Focusing on the aspects of sustainability and the use of technology in the field of politics
At the end of 2021, PMY organizes 7 L&A activities at national level and demonstrate the ability to gather, align on objectives, and lobby and advocate for developmental and thematic reforms.

NIMD Jordan has already initiated several L&A activities in 2021 through dialogue platforms at national levels addressing political reforms and women’s participation.

2 initiatives were proposed and submitted by SoP participants. They are: • One initiative was proposed by the SoP youth on promoting the participation of youth in the local councils. This was prepared and then presented to MPs. • Another initiative proposed on enhancing and development of the central markets in governorates

comment.narrative: PMY at local or national levels gather, deliberate their priorities for political and thematic and developmental reforms and unite through common agreements which they use to drive L&A campaigns. This is a new approach we are taking so there is no baseline

Five proposed agreements were presented • A political discussion roundtable including several secretary generals of political parties and former MPs produced a paper of recommendations for political reforms which were submitted to the government. • Three initiatives by women who participated in the program organized in cooperation with IRI one was presented to the women affairs committee at the house of representatives, a second submitted to the women sub-committee of the Royal Committee, and a third submitted to the head of the Royal Committee. • A letter with the recommendations by the SoP youth, based on the dialogue session that was held on Friday, July 30, 2021, with members of the Royal Committee to Modernize the Political System, presented to the head of the committee HE Samir Al-Rifai, Chairman of the Royal Committee to Modernize the Political System.

title.narrative: # of multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings (at national level)

description.narrative: # of multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings (at national level)

comment.narrative: PMY at local or national levels already have lots of dialogue with local and and national politicians and officials. Yet these interactions tend to be sporadic and not directed at specific outcomes. Generally, PMY gather and deliberate their priorities for political and thematic and developmental reforms and then interact minimally with political actors. NIMD Jordan will initiate dialogue platforms between PMY among themselves and also with political actors to build trust, and provide insight into political decision-making processes and an opportunity to actively participate politics through setting their own priorities and agenda and initiating and running L&A. By identifying key issues and prioritize policy agendas relevant to them they will achieve effective advocacy that leads to changes and improvements.

Eight dialogue meetings were held: • Expert round table session attended by 16 persons. Collaboration with Politics and Society Institute. In response to the royal call for political and administrative reforms, Attendance included experts and activists in politics. • Two dissociation session, in person with some members of the Royal Committee to modernize the political system for SoP participants • One dissociation session, in person with some members of the Royal Committee to modernize the political and women participating in the program organized with IRI • Three dialogue sessions with women MPs personal experience in running for the Parliamentary Elections 2020 and the challenges that accompanied the election campaigns during the pandemic”. With women participating in the program organized with IRI. • Dialogue session with Minister of Youth and participants of the SoP
A traceable and verifiable record of interaction including a series of 8 multi stakeholder dialogue meetings to prioritize dialogues between PMY and political actors to build trust

title.narrative: # of multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings (at sub-national level)

description.narrative: # of multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings (at sub-national level)

comment.narrative: PMY at local or national levels already have lots of dialogue with local and national politicians and officials. Yet these interactions tend to be sporadic and not directed at specific outcomes. Generally, PMY gather and deliberate their priorities for political and thematic and developmental reforms and then interact minimally with political actors. NIMD Jordan will initiate dialogue platforms between PMY among themselves and with political actors to build trust, and provide insight into political decision-making processes and an opportunity to actively participate politics through setting their own priorities and agenda and initiating and running L&A. By identifying key issues and prioritize policy agendas relevant to them they will achieve effective advocacy that leads to changes and improvements.

3 dialogue meetings were held: • Women participating in the program organized with IRI participated in a dialogue session on the draft law on "Municipalities and Decentralization" attended by 15 persons, Speakers included: Israa Mahadin • Two dialogue sessions for youth were held within the "Dialogue Incubator," in Karak Governorate - Youth and Creativity Center, with the participation of the Institute of Politics and Society

comment.narrative: Jordan still one of the outstanding countries when comes to low youth participation in civic and political process. This is beside women almost unrepresented in any aspect of public life. One of the critical issues in Jordan for youth and women participation is the lack of engagement with formal civil society bodies. The on-going restrictions on these bodies, causing a lot of damage to youth and women participation.
Target for 2022 onwards.

title.narrative: # of agreements reached (reform agendas / policies / legal amendments)

description.narrative: # of agreements reached (reform agendas / policies / legal amendments)

comment.narrative: NIMD Jordan will include 2 women led / centered CSOs in its programming aiming at regulatory reforms to increase women’s participation and leadership in the public sphere as engagement in productive dialogue meetings with PMY and focus groups to align over the state of democratic space including women’s political participation.

5 agreements were reached: • Politicians in Jordan making recommendations for the reform of the political and democratic landscape in Jordan. • SoP youth making recommendations t o the Royal committee for modernising the political landscape. • Women participating in the program “women in local administration” agreeing and making three recommendations for reform of the political landscape around women empowerment, municipal laws, and political reform in general.

title.narrative: # of CSOs included in the PoD programme (youth led)

description.narrative: # of CSOs included in the PoD programme (youth led)

comment.narrative: One of the critical issues in Jordan for youth and women participation is the lack of engagement with formal civil society bodies. Though most youth and women would like to see more democratic or inclusive political structures, there is less consensus on what that should actually look like. The relations between politically engaged women and youth and Jordanian political parties are mostly defined by a lack of trust and self-chosen independence on the side of youth and women. Nonetheless, some groups of women, youth and political parties are building alliances that have proven useful in mobilizing for protests, and that could prove sustainable in the future.

3 CSOs included in the PoD : • The Crown Prince Foundation (CPF) and NIMD Jordan Signed an MoU to collaborate in running different capacity development interventions for CPF youth partners, on crucial skills and knowledge related to youth participation.
• The Politics and Society Institute and NIMD Jordan signed and MOU for running a pilot to hold national dialogue
• Youth and Creativity Center partnered with NIMD Jordan in implementing youth led active dialogue sessions to promote youth political participation.

title.narrative: # of L&A activities for making the political system more inclusive (in relation to women / youth / minority groups) at national level

description.narrative: # of L&A activities for making the political system more inclusive (in relation to women / youth / minority groups) at national level

comment.narrative: This is a new stream of activities that promotes dialogue between political actors and the PMY (individuals or affiliated with CSOs) to develop greater trust which will serve the effort of advocacy through establishing partnerships or coalitions.

4 including: 1- A discussion with the Ministry of Youth and NIMD SoP students advocating new usage of the youth centres in governorates for empowerment of youth. 2- SoP students agreeing and petitioning the royal committee for several measures to promote youth inclusion in national politics 3- Women in local administration agreeing and petitioning the parliament for a legislation to empower women in politics 4- Women in local administration agreeing and petitioning the royal committee on several topics around political parties, youth, and women.

By 2025, and on yearly basis, NIMD Jo will work with 4 local CSOs and national CSOs (they may repeat) where each CSO will produce at least two proposals which will form the basis for dialogue and lobby and advocacy. Dialogue and workshop are activities that aim to bring different political activists and NGO and CSOs together to address current state of women political and civic rights and align over needed actions aiming at regulatory reform to increase women’s participation and leadership in the public sphere. reform steps.
